author: eTN Editor
title: Best way to help Nepal?
text:
Best way to help Nepal?   
By Anil Mathur, eTN India Correspondent | Sep 09, 2015 eTN   
INDIA (eTN) - Nepal took great pains and made efforts at the PATA mart in Bangalore, India, which ended on September 8, to send the message that the best way to help the Himalayan country was to visit it, i.e., please engage tourism here. 
Officials and industry players said that after the April 25 earthquake, things are almost normal for the tourists, and the places hit by the quake are now restored, as far as tourist places are concerned. 
However, they admitted that total restoration work will take some more time but the places visited by the tourists are now open and safe. Reputed foreign agencies have also certified to this, they claimed. 
Giving figures, the Nepal industry players said that several teams have been given permits for trekking and mountaineering now. 
A panel has been formed by the government for the revival of tourism, called the Nepal Tourism Promotion Committee, to specifically address the post-quake issues. 
Several trade teams have been sent to shows and destinations to convey the message that Nepal is back on top of the world. 
Nepal Airlines has resumed flights to Mumbai and Bangalore, and is offering a special buy-two-get-one-free package. 
India is and has been a major source for Nepal, but the recent political turmoil in the country impacted tourism, senior officers admitted.
